item.title: Terminable Loop Command 1.2.1
item.description: This small new patch was needed because we discovered that PHP official Docker images override the STOPSIGNAL directive, using SIGQUIT instead of SIGTERM when shutting down a container. Thanks to Gabriele Colombera for providing the PR.

item.title: Terminable Loop Command 1.2.0
item.description: This new minor release is a maintenance one, which drops support for older (and EOLed) PHP & Symfony versions; this allowed me to bump all the development dependencies and streamline the CI flow.

item.title: Terminable Loop Command 1.1.0
item.description: This is just a small upgrade of a very stable package, that adds support for PHP 8 and Symfony 5.

item.title: Terminable Loop Command 1.0
item.description:
This is the first release of this package! It’s Shell+PHP combination to run Symfony console commands in loop under a daemon or Kubernetes, instead of using a long running process.

This package contains a shell script and an abstract Symfony Console Command class; you need to write your command extending that class, and launch it through the shell script. Ideally, the script has to be used as a container entry point, and/or launched with a supervisor, like Docker Compose, Kubernetes, supervisord.
